page.title: 03RIVER LYNHER
page.content: The{river Lynher}winds its way across the area towards its junction with the{Tamar at Saltash,}creating a deep valley. At{Newbridge,}the river is about {20 metres wide, 50 centimetres deep and contains many large stones, pebbles and undergrowth. It is fast flowing with many strong currents. In the past the river water was used to power several mills. At {Frogwell,}the mill leat still exists, but the flour mill containing an undershot wheel was destroyed in 1950 since it was unsafe. Water power was also used at{Newton}and{Newbridge. Nowadays, the river is used for {fishing and canoeing,}mainly by the Liskeard Angling Club and Callington Comprehensive School. It also marks the{parish boundary}between Callington and St.Ive.
